sponsor.partnerMessage: The first ever ReWired Fest is happening Oct 21-22 at Bud Walton Arena. The two-day festival will feature esports tournaments, gaming, music, action sports, food trucks, and live music! The event is for all ages and free to attend. Click here to learn more.

posts.title: J.B. Hunt Beats Analyst Estimates For Third Quarter Earnings
posts.content:
After the markets closed yesterday, J.B. Hunt reported its earnings, beating out several analysts’ quarterly estimates. 

  • Earnings and revenue: J.B. Hunt’s reported earnings increased by 34.8% to $269.38m, or $2.57 per share, from $199.82m, or $1.88 per share, in the same quarter last year. Revenue also rose by 22.1% to $3.83b, from $3.14b.
  • Proceed with caution: During the report, J.B. Hunt execs appeared optimistic about the “better than feared” quarter yet cautious about the market, staying ready to pivot if necessary. 

Read the full Talk Business & Politics story HERE.

posts.title: Bentonville Weighs Proposal For 7-Story Apartment Development
posts.content:
The Bentonville Planning Commission is considering a proposal for a 7-story, mixed-use apartment complex at the corner of Central and Battlefield.

  • Meeting a need: The development designed by Modus Studio would bring needed housing to the area, providing nearly 545 multi-family housing units. 
  • Concerns: While the development has some residents excited, others have concerns about the location’s tendency to flood and the development’s impact on already problematic traffic. 

See notes from the planning meeting HERE. Skip to page 63.

posts.title: Mycelium Lays Groundwork For The Future Of The Internet
posts.content:
Committed to the world's adoption of decentralized networks, Mycelium Networks is building the physical infrastructure needed to begin implementing Web 3.0 solutions right here in NWA. 

  • Their latest peak: Mycelium proudly participated and presented in the Web 3.0 track at the 2022 NWA Tech Summit which concluded yesterday in Bentonville.  
  • Their latest plans: Mycelium offers multiple Host Plans for individuals and businesses with payments ranging from $15-$55 per month. 

Join the growing Host Network and compare plans HERE.

posts.title: Stargaze This Weekend At Arkansas’s First Ever Dark Sky Festival
posts.content:
Celebrate the marvelous night sky over the Buffalo National River this weekend at the first ever Arkansas’s Dark Sky Festival, Oct 21-22 at Tyler Bend Campground. 

  • Stargazing: The event will include family-friendly activities like a constellation tour, telescopic star party, celestial art class, nocturnal wildlife, light pollution awareness, nightscape photography contest, and solar-roasting marshmallows.
  • Meteor shower: Around midnight Friday, the Orionid Meteor Shower will peak, giving stargazers an incredible view of falling stars. Participants are encouraged to bring their own binoculars or telescopes, though a limited amount will be available for rent. 

Check out this celestial event HERE and enjoy more photography of the Ozarks by local, Jason P Frank HERE.

posts.title: It's A Groundbreaking Day For The Food Hub In Downtown Springdale
posts.content:
Join the groundbreaking ceremony for the Market Center of the Ozarks today from 10-11a in Downtown Springdale at 713 E Meadow Ave.

  • A central hub: The 45,000-sq-ft facility will be a resource hub for farmers and food entrepreneurs, providing crop aggregation capabilities, commercial kitchens, and community spaces for learning.  
  • Family approved: The Walton Family Foundation will support the project as part of the NWA Food Systems Initiative, which works to empower small and mid-size farmers and improve access to local food. 

Read more about this exciting project HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Abracadabra: World-famous illusionist, Reza, is coming to the Jones Center for a one-show-only event on Nov 6. Get your tickets HERE.* 
  • Run for a reason: Register for the Purple for a Purpose 5K and 1 Mile Fun Run this Saturday, Oct 22 at Veterans Memorial Park in Fayetteville. The race raises awareness for the issue of domestic violence in our community.* 
  • Cheers: Raise a glass for Girls on the Run at the High Gravity Home Brewing Tasting & Competition on Saturday, Oct 22.
  • Roots: Sadly, the Fayetteville Roots Festival has decided to shut down operations. We’ll miss this once staple music festival. 
  • Hey pumpkin: If you don’t put pumpkins on your doorstep, how will anyone know that it’s fall, y’all? Here’s a guide to some local pumpkin patches!
  • Plus tax: This voting season, Siloam Springs residents will vote on how they want their sales tax revenue to be allocated. 
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
